snippet: New York City's plans for a parade to celebrate the Giants' Super Bowl victory have upset some returned Iraq veterans, who are themselves awaiting recognition.
abstract: New York City's plans for a parade to celebrate the Giants' Super Bowl victory have upset some returned Iraq veterans, who are themselves awaiting recognition.
lead_paragraph: An article in Tuesday's issue of The Times reports that New York City's plans for a parade to celebrate the Giants' Super Bowl victory have upset some returned Iraq veterans, who are themselves awaiting recognition. Kate Taylor writes that Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg decided that a parade would be premature while American soldiers were still fighting in Afghanistan, citing advice from the Pentagon. But a growing coalition disagrees with that assessment. Read the full article.

headline.main: Calls for a New York City Parade Honoring Iraq Veterans

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
